text: ‚ÄúMarket liberals‚Äù and ‚Äúcivic liberals‚Äù both believe that freedom can be compartmentalised according to their convenience. Unless a free society and free economy coexist , there can be no genuine freedom. 5/5

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: The essential quality of reformist legislation is allowing dissent and disagreement to be expressed institutionally, in parliament, through standing ctties. When such institutional disagreement is denied, dissent inevitably goes to street 4/5

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: The suggestion is made by ‚Äúmarket liberals‚Äù that protest for a ‚Äúwrong‚Äù cause is unjustified. But freedom can only have meaning when the right to protest applies to even some people who think a cause is justified 3/5

It is hard not to be emotional in this moment. 

We have had a president who fomented division and chaos, attacked doctors and science in the midst of the worst public health crisis in a century, and damaged our democracy.

But we have turned him out and given decency a chance.

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: Since neither @INCIndia nor @BJP4India is democratic, few politicians know how to behave democratically, or understand dissent, free argument, policy making. Because they can only understand power and operate in a feudal world they know only genuflection, worship or bullying.

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: Vajpayee was a convinced Hindu nationalist but located his politics in parliament, in resisting RSS control. His defeat pushed @BJP4India into arms of Hindutva nationalism. So today it‚Äôs non democratic Gandhi family and non democratic RSS family and the parties they control. End

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: Indira split @INCIndia twice, creating present Cong which is entirely a family enterprise. By imposing the Emergency she delivered a body blow. She also gave the Hindu cause respectability by playing Hindutva politics in Punjab, J&K.

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: This is because of early erosion of democratic norms, particularly by Indira Gandhi who was no democrat, instead an authoritarian leader who herself dabbled in Hindutva politics post 1980 creating what @jaffrelotc describes as the ‚Äúerosion of the secularist norm‚Äù

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: That‚Äôs why India is what Ashis Nandy once called a ‚Äúpsephocracy‚Äù not a democracy. Only elections are held for the sake of power. But parties remain non democratic and tied to either monarchical families or ethno-religious nationalism

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: India‚Äôs 2 main parties win power through democracy yet both shot through with feudal authoritarianism. In @INCIndia loyalty demanded to dynastic bloodlines, in @BJP4India you have to be loyal to an unelected majoritarian outfit @RSSorg. Gandhi parivar or Sangh parivar. Thread

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: By insisting that the state does not get away with extra judicial killings, ‚Äúhuman rights wallahs‚Äù protect the rule of law, which is the only thing that genuinely protects every citizen. ( thread ends)

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: The Yogi Adityanath government in UP has also initiated an ‚Äúencounter raj‚Äù in which 50 criminals have been eliminated between 2017-2018. There is no evidence that encounter killings stop crime, rather they spur more violence

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: So called ‚Äúencounter killings‚Äù are not new. In Mumbai ‚Äúencounter specialists‚Äù gunned down members of the underworld between 1999-2001 and were unthinkingly glorified by Bollywood

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: It is the commitment to rule of law which alone can distinguish between terrorist use of violence and lawful use of force by the government. Encounter killings may fire public imagination but create conditions for increasing violence in every day life.

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: Every encounter begets more criminals, both inside and outside the security agencies. The government and state agencies cannot mimic the terrorist but always act lawfully

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: across the board, to various non-government actors. Why should gau Rakshaks or outfits like the Karni Sena simply not take up arms to defend themselves against those they see as ‚Äúcriminals?‚Äù State power should not normalise and legitimise the cult of violence.

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: Encounter killings, or killings outside the judicial process should be abhorrent & repugnant in a democracy. The argument that ‚ÄúDirty Harry‚Äù cops who pull the trigger and  make society safer is false.  If govts stage ‚Äúfake encounters‚Äù, they signal tacit permission for violence

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: In my book #WhyIAmALiberal I have offered analysis on India‚Äôs ‚Äúencounter raj‚Äù. Thread: https://t.co/GsYgMJXEqw

name: Sagarika Ghose
text: India‚Äôs ‚Äúencounter raj‚Äù. Violence only begets more violence. After every ‚Äúencounter‚Äù criminals are created on both sides, within the security agencies and outside. Violence is like Covid, very infectious. #fake_encounter #VikasDubey https://t.co/cCl1r4oh1X

text: The depths of superstition and foolishness that India is now descending into is so dark and so fetid, that it‚Äôs questionable whether we‚Äôll ever be able to climb out again. And yet how hard our founders fought for rationality, for sanity, for escape from blind beliefs. #Covid_19
